newsitem.title: USA: C-Cube says Sony to use its decoder.
newsitem.headline: C-Cube says Sony to use its decoder.

text.p: C-Cube Microsystems Inc said electronics giant Sony Corp has selected C-Cube's CL9100 decoder for use in Sony's digital set-top receiver for broadcast television signals.

Financial details of the agreement were undisclosed, but digital set-top boxes to include C-Cube's MPEG-2 decoder are Sony's DST-500JS models, which will be used for the PerfecTV digital television system being rolled-out in Japan.
PerfecTV will deliver 70 channels of TV programming and 100 radio channels, as well as a variety of video, educational and interactive services not previously available in Japan.
